warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate your shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Slowly straighten your arms and lift them until you feel a stretch in your chest. Hold for 15 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend your elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently pull your elbow toward your head with your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with your hands facing outwards. Unrack the barbell and position it above your chest.
execution: 1. Lower the bar slowly to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
3. Push the bar back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. If you can do more than 8, increase the weight for the next set.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the bench to an incline position (around 30-45 degrees). Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly narrower than shoulder-width, with your hands facing outwards. Unrack the barbell and position it above your chest.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Lower the bar slowly to your upper chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
3. Push the bar back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. If you can do more than 8, increase the weight for the next set.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a stable core throughout the exercise. Avoid bouncing the bar off your chest.

exercises.setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height suitable for a seated position. Sit on the seat and grip the handles. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
execution: 1. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your pecs at the end of the movement.
2. Slowly return to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your pecs.
3. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Focus on the controlled movement and the stretch in the pecs.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are almost parallel to the floor.
2. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your pecs.
3. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Focus on the controlled movement and the stretch in the pecs.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection, feeling the stretch and contraction in your pecs.

exercises.setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Keeping your core engaged and back straight, press the barbell straight overhead until your arms are fully extended.
2. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, maintaining control.
3. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. If you can do more than 8, increase the weight for the next set.
exercises.additional_tips: Avoid arching your back. Keep your core tight throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Extend your arms fully overhead, holding the bar attachment.
2. Keeping your arms straight, bend your elbows and lower the bar behind your head.
3. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Focus on the controlled movement and the stretch in the triceps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Extend your arms fully overhead, holding the barbell.
2. Keeping your upper arms stationary, lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows.
3. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form. Focus on the controlled movement and the stretch in the triceps.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid swinging the weight.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width, with your hands facing outwards. Unrack the barbell and position it above your chest.
execution: 1. Lower the bar slowly to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
2. Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest.
3. Push the bar back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 repetitions with good form. Focus on controlled movement.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to a high cable pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. Keeping your upper arms close to your sides, extend your forearms downwards until your arms are fully extended.
3. Slowly return to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 repetitions with good form. Focus on controlled movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid swinging the weight.
